intro: Dysosmia fluminensis, commonly known as the Fluminense Dysosmia, is a rare flowering plant native to the subtropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Dysosmia fluminensis is considered a species of conservation concern.
